letters.description: Identify chronic people-pleasing, enmeshment patterns, and the compulsion to fix or control others.
Trace the origins of caretaking behaviors back to family-of-origin systems and attachment wounds.
Rebuild an internal sense of self-worth and identity that is independent of external validation.
Design and implement clear physical, emotional, and energetic boundaries to protect the self.
Reclaim the right to make independent choices and practice radical self-responsibility for one's own needs.
Transition from enmeshed dynamics to healthy, reciprocal, and balanced relationship structures.
Solidify self-trust and maintain long-term recovery through consistent self-care and awareness.
